page.title: 02HOME LIFE 1 BISHOP THORNTON
page.content: A day in the life of Josephine Lloyd There are three children in our family I'm 7 and the boys are 6 and 4. We live in a converted farmhouse. I wake at 7.45 am and have breakfast of cereal and orange juice. After washing and dressing I practice the piano while I wait for the boys. At school we play our brass instruments and recorders, then do Mathematics for an hour. After play we do creative writing and topic work. We take our words home to learn every Thursday night and have a spelling test on Friday. Some children bring a packed lunch but school dinners cost 67 pence My mother is a nurse and my dad is a retired teacher. He calls himself Charlie Muggins because he has to do all the jobs. After school my brother goes for swiming lessons I can swim. I go to bed at 8.30pm and read for a bit
